intro: Brachysema celsianum, commonly known as the slender balsam, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are usually pink or white, and the plant produces small, elongated pods that contain the seeds.
